definition: to stay with sb/to ask for lodging
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)

sentences.english: I had stayed in London for several days, lived in a friend's home.
sentences.chinese: 我有些天在伦敦，借宿在朋友家。

sentences.english: When people left homeless when a night shelter to promote social harmony.
sentences.chinese: 当别人无家可归的时候，一晚借宿能促进社会的和谐。

sentences.english: Can you put me up for the night?
Xiao yu find small north, puts forward a late night, small north agreed.
sentences.chinese: 小雨找到小北，提出借宿一晚，小北答应了。

sentences.english: I lodge at my good friend that at times.
sentences.chinese: 我偶而会借宿在我好朋友那。

sentences.english: The three tired travellers asked for a night's lodging.
sentences.chinese: 三个疲惫的旅行者请求借宿一夜。

sentences.english: Two travelling angels stopped to spend the night in the home of a wealthy family.
sentences.chinese: 两个旅行中的天使到一个富有的家庭借宿。

sentences.english: It is a dusk a businessman came and hoped to stay for one night.
sentences.chinese: 一天黄昏时一个商人来向渔夫借宿一晚。

definition: to put up a guest/to stay overnight
to sleep outdoors/to spend the night in the open
to offer shelter/to have sb in one's care
to make one's bed on the floor
to stop on the way for a rest
